  • Constructor Details

    • DataAccessObject

      public DataAccessObject() throws SQLException
      This is the constructor which throws an SQLException
      Throws:
      SQLException - it throws SQLException for unsuccessful database connection or sql syntax error

  • Method Details

    • setColumnValues

      public void setColumnValues(String... values)

      This is used to set field values based on the number of fields within an entity, in case of complete table insertion or specified selected fields required. This method is accessed or invoked using the instance of the class.

      It is used with the insert, bulk-insert and update methods. It is used along with the setColumnNames(String...columns) method to set the values for all the columns added. As a result, must match the number of parameters in the setColumnNames(String...columns) method.

      It is USED ONLY when you are inserting into all the fields and using the insertSecuredRecord(String tableName, Connection conn) and insertRecord(String tableName, Connection conn) methods

      E.g: 
                DataAccessObject obj = new DataAccessObject();
      
          obj.setColumnValues(val1,val2,...);
      Parameters:
      values - represents the column values

    • setColumnNames

      public void setColumnNames(String... columns)

      This is used to set field names based on the number of fields within an entity, in case of complete table insertion or specified selected fields required. This method is accessed or invoked using the instance of the class.

      It is used with the insert, bulk-insert and update methods. It is always used with the setColumnValues(String... values)

      E.g: 
                DataAccessObject obj = new DataAccessObject();
      
          obj.setColumnNames(val1,val2,...);
      Parameters:
      columns - represents the columns

    • setBulkValues

      public void setBulkValues(String... values)
      This method is used to set multiple records values to bulk insert.

      when used with the bulkSelectedInsert(String tableName, Connection connect), the setColumnNames(String...columns) method is also used to specify the selected columns to bulk insert. For example: 

            obj.setColumnNames(col1, col2, col3);
      obj.setBulkValues(val1, val2, val3);
      obj.setBulkValues(val1, val2, val3);
      obj.setBulkValues(val1, val2, val3);
      bulkSelectedInsert(String tableName, Connection connect)

      However, when used with bulkInsert(String tableName, Connection connect) method columm names setting is not required. For instance: 

            obj.setBulkValues(val1, val2, val3);
      obj.setBulkValues(val1, val2, val3);
      obj.setBulkValues(val1, val2, val3);
      bulkInsert(String tableName, Connection connect)
      Parameters:
      values - represents the record values

    • setQuerys

      public void setQuerys(String query)
      This method is used for implementing transactional(commit/rollback) operations. It is used to set multiple custom queries for execution, and used with the batchRecord(Connection conn) method.
      Parameters:
      query - represents user defined query

    • batchRecord

      public static int batchRecord(Connection conn)
      This method is used to execute batch custom sql queries. It works with the setQuerys(String query) method.
      Parameters:
      conn - repressent the connection object
      Returns:
      0 - for a successful transactional operation. 1 - for a unsuccessful transactinal operation. -1 - for an unsucessful database connection. 
        E.g:
  obj.setQuerys(query1);
  obj.setQuerys(query2);
  obj.setQuerys(query3);
  int val = batchRecord(conn);

    • insertRecord

      public static int insertRecord(String tableName, Connection conn)
      This method is used to insert record to all the the fields in the table. It works with the setColumnValues(String...values) method. 
        E.g:
  obj.setColumnValues(val1, val2, val3, val4, val5,...);
  int res = insertRecord(tableName, connect);
      Parameters:
      tableName - specify table name
      conn - represent the connection object.
      Returns:
      0 - for a successful operation. -1 - for an unsucessful database connection.

    • insertSecuredRecord

      public static int insertSecuredRecord(String tableName, Connection conn)
      This method is used to insert record to all the the fields in the table. This method implements escape parameter to hold each record values. Hence, more secured. It works with the setColumnValues(String...values) method. 
        E.g:
  obj.setColumnValues(val1, val2, val3, val4, val5,...);
  int res = insertSecuredRecord(tableName, connect);
      Parameters:
      tableName - specify table name
      conn - represent the connection object.
      Returns:
      0 - for a successful operation. -1 - for an unsuccessful database connection.

    • insertSelectedRecord

      public static int insertSelectedRecord(String tableName, Connection conn)
      This method is used to insert record to all the fields in the table. This method implements escape parameter to hold each record values. Hence, more secured. It works with the setColumnValues(String...values) method. 
        E.g:
  obj.setColumnValues(val1, val2, val3, val4, val5,...);
  int res = insertSecuredRecord(tableName, connect);
      Parameters:
      tableName - specify table name
      conn - represent the connection object.
      Returns:
      0 - for a successful operation. -1 - for an unsuccessful database connection. 1 - for columns count does not harmonize with values count

    • insertSecuredSelectedRecord

      public static int insertSecuredSelectedRecord(String tableName, Connection conn)
      This method is used to insert selected fields record to all the fields in the table. This method implements escape parameter to hold each record values. Hence, more secured. It works with the setColumnNames(String...columns) and setColumnValues(String...values) methods. 
        obj.setColumnNames(col1, col2, col3, col4, col5,...);
  obj.setColumnValues(val1, val2, val3, val4, val5,...);
  int res = insertSecuredSelectedRecord(tableName, connect);
      Parameters:
      tableName - represents the table name
      conn - represents the connection object
      Returns:
      -1: could not establish connection with database 1: columns count does not harmonize with values count 0: data successfully committed/inserted to database

    • updateRecord

      public static int updateRecord(String conditionColumn, String conditionValue, String tableName, Connection conn)
      This method is used to update database record. It uses the setColumnNames(String...columns) and setColumnValues(String...values) methods to set the columns/ fields being updated. 
        obj.setColumnNames(col1, col2, col3, col4, col5,...);
  obj.setColumnValues(val1, val2, val3, val4, val5,...);
  int res = updateRecord(conditionColumn, conditionColumnValue, tableName, connect);
      Parameters:
      conditionColumn - specify the condition column name that identifies the record to be updated.
      conditionValue - specify the value for the condition column name
      tableName - specifies the table name
      conn - represents the connection
      Returns:
      -1: could not establish connection with database 1: columns count does not harmonize with values count 0: data successfully updated to database

    • updateSecuredRecord

      public static int updateSecuredRecord(String conditionColumn, String conditionValue, String tableName, Connection conn)
      This method is used to update database record. It uses the setColumnNames(String...columns) and setColumnValues(String...values) methods to set the columns/ fields being updated. This method is more secured as it implements the escape parameter to set the values. 
        obj.setColumnNames(col1, col2, col3, col4, col5,...);
  obj.setColumnValues(val1, val2, val3, val4, val5,...);
  int res = updateSecuredRecord(conditionColumn, conditionColumnValue, tableName, connect);
      Parameters:
      conditionColumn - specify the condition column name that identifies the record to be updated.
      conditionValue - specify the value for the condition column name
      tableName - specifies the table name
      conn - represents the connection
      Returns:
      -1: could not establish connection with database 1: columns count does not harmonize with values count 0: data successfully committed to database

    • updateRecordMulCond

      public static int updateRecordMulCond(String mulCondColumn, String mulCondValue, String tableName, Connection conn)
      This method is used to update database record. It uses the setColumnNames(String...columns) and setColumnValues(String...values) methods to set the columns/ fields being updated. 
        String mulCondColumn = "conditionCol1,"+"conditionCol2,...";
  String mulCondValue = "val1,"+"val2,...";
  obj.setColumnNames(col1, col2, col3, col4, col5,...);
  obj.setColumnValues(val1, val2, val3, val4, val5,...);
  int res = updateRecordMulCond(mulCondColumn, mulCondValue, tableName, connect);
      Parameters:
      mulCondColumn - represents a String of concatenated multiple condition columns
      mulCondValue - represents a String of concatenated multiple condition columns values
      tableName - represents the table name
      conn - represents the connection
      Returns:
      -1: could not establish connection with database -2: condition columns count does not harmonize with condition values count -3: columns count does not harmonize with values count 0: data successfully committed to database

    • updateSecuredRecordMulCond

      public static int updateSecuredRecordMulCond(String mulCondColumn, String mulCondValue, String tableName, Connection conn)
      This method is used to update database record. It uses the setColumnNames(String...columns) and setColumnValues(String...values) methods to set the columns/ fields being updated.

      This method is more secured as it implements the escape parameter to set the values. 

        String mulCondColumn = "conditionCol1,"+"conditionCol2,...";
  String mulCondValue = "val1,"+"val2,...";
  obj.setColumnNames(col1, col2, col3, col4, col5,...);
  obj.setColumnValues(val1, val2, val3, val4, val5,...);
  int res = updateSecuredRecordMulCond(mulCondColumn, mulCondValue, tableName, connect);
      Parameters:
      mulCondColumn - represents a String of concatenated multiple condition columns
      mulCondValue - represents a String of concatenated multiple condition columns values
      tableName - represents the table name
      conn - represents the connection
      Returns:
      -1: could not establish connection with database -2: condition columns count does not harmonize with condition values count -3: columns count does not harmonize with values count 0: data successfully committed to database

    • deleteRecord

      public static int deleteRecord(String tableName, Connection conn, String columnName, String value)
      This method is used to delete a record from the database.
      Parameters:
      tableName - represents the table name
      conn - represents the connection
      columnName - represents the condition column name
      value - represents the condition column value
      Returns:
      0 - for successful deletion -1 - for failure to delete record. Either bad connection or invalid record criteria

  bulkInsert(String tableName, Connection connect);

    • bulkDelete

      public static int bulkDelete(String primaryKey, String tableName, Connection connect, String begin, String end)
      This method is used to delete bulk records from the database. 
        int result = bulkDelete(keyColumn, table, connect, begin, end);
      Parameters:
      primaryKey - represents the primary key/ condition column
      tableName - represents the table name.
      connect - represents the connection object.
      begin - represents the start range value
      end - represents the end range value
      Returns:
      -1: could not establish connection with database 0: data successfully deleted to database

    • getTableRowCount

      public static int getTableRowCount(String columnName, String tableName, Connection connnect)
      This method is used to return the total number of records inserted into a table
      Parameters:
      columnName - the column name used for counting.
      tableName - represents the table name
      connnect - represents the connection
      Returns:
      total number of rows/records or 0 if table is empty

    • getDynaRowCount

      public static int getDynaRowCount(String conditionColumn, String conditionValue, String tableName, Connection conn)
      This method is used to return the total number of records inserted into a table based on a satisfied criteria.
      Parameters:
      conditionColumn - represents the condition column
      conditionValue - represents the condition column value
      tableName - represents the table name.
      conn - represent the connection object.
      Returns:
      total number of rows/records or 0 if table is empty

    • getCustomRowCount

      public static int getCustomRowCount(String query, Connection conn)
      This method is used to return the total number of records inserted into a table. This method executes custom user defined query.
      Parameters:
      query - represents query with the COUNT function to be executed.
      conn - represent the connection object.
      Returns:
      total number of rows/records or 0 if table is empty

    • loadAllRecord

      public static WebRowSet loadAllRecord(String tableName, Connection connect)
      This method is used to populate all records from the database table. 
        E.g.:   WebRowSet dac = loadAllRecord(table, connect);
      Parameters:
      tableName - represents the table name.
      connect - represent the connection object.
      Returns:
      a WebRowSet object containing all records.

    • loadPaginatedAllRecord

      public static WebRowSet loadPaginatedAllRecord(String offset, String rowcount, String tableName, Connection connect)
      This method is used to populate a portion/limited records from the database table. It is designed to be used to implement PAGINATION. 
        E.g.:   WebRowSet dac = loadPaginatedAllRecord(offset, rowcount, table, connect);
      Parameters:
      offset - represents the start position of the record to be returned.
      rowcount - represents the total number of records to return
      tableName - represents the table name.
      connect - represent the connection object.
      Returns:
      a WebRowSet object containing the specified number of records from the specified start position.

    • loadPaginatedAllRecordSorted

      public static WebRowSet loadPaginatedAllRecordSorted(String columnName, String offset, String rowcount, String tableName, Connection connect, Boolean flag)
      This method is used to populate a sorted portion/limited records from the database table. It is designed to be used to implement PAGINATION. 
        E.g.:   WebRowSet dac = loadPaginatedAllRecordOrdered(columnName, offset, rowcount, table, connect, true);
      Parameters:
      columnName - represents the column to be sorted.
      offset - represents the start position of the record to be returned.
      rowcount - represents the total number of records to return
      tableName - represents the table name.
      connect - represent the connection object.
      flag - represents sort type. 'True' for 'asc' and 'False' for 'desc'
      Returns:
      a sorted WebRowSet object containing the specified number of records from the specified start position.

    • loadPaginatedDynaRecord

      public static WebRowSet loadPaginatedDynaRecord(String offset, String rowcount, String tableName, Connection connect)
      This method is used to populate a portion/limited records from the database table. It is designed to be used to implement PAGINATION based on a criteria. It works with setColumnNames(String...columns) and setColumnValues(String...values) 
        E.g.:   
  obj.setColumnNames(col1, col2,...n);
  obj.setColumnValues(val1, val2,...n);
  WebRowSet dac = loadPaginatedDynaRecord(offset, rowcount, table, connect);
      Parameters:
      offset - represents the start position of the record to be returned.
      rowcount - represents the total number of records to return
      tableName - represents the table name.
      connect - represent the connection object.
      Returns:
      a WebRowSet object containing the specified number of records from the specified start position.

    • loadPaginatedDynaRecordOrdered

      public static WebRowSet loadPaginatedDynaRecordOrdered(String columnName, String offset, String rowcount, String tableName, Connection connect, Boolean flag)
      This method is used to populate a sorted portion/limited records from the database table. It is designed to be used to implement PAGINATION based on a criteria. It works with setColumnNames(String...columns) and setColumnValues(String...values) 
        E.g.:   
  obj.setColumnNames(col1, col2,...n);
  obj.setColumnValues(val1, val2,...n);
  WebRowSet dac = loadPaginatedDynaRecordOrdered(column, offset, rowcount, table, connect);
      Parameters:
      columnName - represents the column to be sorted.
      offset - represents the start position of the record to be returned.
      rowcount - represents the total number of records to return
      tableName - represents the table name.
      connect - represent the connection object.
      flag - represents sort type. 'True' for 'asc' and 'False' for 'desc'
      Returns:
      a sorted WebRowSet object containing the specified number of records from the specified start position.

    • loadAllSortedRecord

      public static WebRowSet loadAllSortedRecord(String tableName, Connection connect, String sortbyColumn, Boolean value)
      This method is used to populate or get all record and sorts the record.
      Parameters:
      tableName - represents the table name
      connect - represents the database connection
      sortbyColumn - the column to be sorted
      value - represents the sort type 'True' for 'asc' and 'False' for 'desc'
      Returns:
      a sorted WebRowSet object containing all records.

    • loadSelectedRecord

      public static WebRowSet loadSelectedRecord(String tableName, Connection connect)
      This method is uaed to fetch selected records. As such it works with the setColumnNames(String...column) method to list the fields/columns to populate.
      Parameters:
      tableName - represents the table name
      connect - represents the database connection
      Returns:
      a WebRowSet object containing all selected records.

    • loadSelectedSortedRecord

      public static WebRowSet loadSelectedSortedRecord(String tableName, Connection connect, String sortbyColumn, Boolean value)
      This method fetches sorted records of selected fields/columns to populate. As such it works with the setColumnNames(String...column) method.
      Parameters:
      tableName - represents the table name
      connect - represents the database connection
      sortbyColumn - the column to be sorted
      value - represents the sort type 'True' for 'asc' and 'False' for 'desc'
      Returns:
      a sorted WebRowSet object containing all selected records.

    • loadAllDynaRecord

      public static WebRowSet loadAllDynaRecord(String conditionColumn, String conditionValue, String tableName, Connection connect)
      This method is used to return all records based on a satisfied condition.
      Parameters:
      conditionColumn - represents the condition column
      conditionValue - represents the condition column value
      tableName - represents the table name
      connect - represents the database connection
      Returns:
      a WebRowSet object containing all records based on the given condition.

    • loadAllSortedDynaRecord

      public static WebRowSet loadAllSortedDynaRecord(String tableName, Connection connect, String conditionCol, String conditionVal, String sortbyColumn, Boolean value)
      This method is used to return all records that is sorted and based on a satisfied condition.
      Parameters:
      tableName - represents the table name
      connect - represents the database connection
      conditionCol - represents the condition column
      conditionVal - represents the condition column value
      sortbyColumn - represents the sorted column.
      value - represents the sort type 'True' for 'asc' and 'False' for 'desc'
      Returns:
      a sorted WebRowSet object containing all records based on the given condition.

    • loadSelectedDynaRecord

      public static WebRowSet loadSelectedDynaRecord(String conditionCol, String conditionVal, String tableName, Connection connect)
      This method is used to return selected records that is based on a satisfied condition. Hence, it works with the setColumnNames(String...column) to list the fields to return.
      Parameters:
      conditionCol - represents the condition column
      conditionVal - represents the condition column value
      tableName - represents the table name
      connect - represents the database connection
      Returns:
      a WebRowSet object containing selected records based on a given condition.

      public static WebRowSet loadAllMulCondition(String tableName, Connection connect)
      This method is used to return all records that is based on a satisfied condition. Hence, it works with the setColumnNames(String...column) and setColumnValues(String...values) methods to list the conditions;
      Parameters:
      tableName - represents the table name
      connect - represents the database connection
      Returns:
      a WebRowSet object containing all records based on multiple columns conditions.

      Parameters:
      tableName - represents the table name
      connect - represents the database connection
      selectedColumn - represents a list of all fields/columns to fetch records

      a WebRowSet object containing selected records based on multiple columns condition.

      Parameters:

      tableName - represents the table name
      connect - represents the database connection

    • loadAllGroupBy

      tableName - represents the table name
      connect - represents the database connection
      Returns:
      a sorted WebRowSet object containing all records that satisfy the GROUP BY function.

    • loadCustomRecord

      public static WebRowSet loadCustomRecord(String query, Connection connect)
      This method is used to execute any user defined custom query.
      Parameters:
      query - represents user defined custome query.
      connect - represents database connection.
      Returns:
      a WebRowSet object containing records from the executed query.

    • loadRecord

      public static LinkedHashMap loadRecord(String tableName, Connection connect, Boolean value)

      This method is used to load the specified columns listed using the setColumnNames(String...columns) method with the first column representing the 'key', and the rest, in the case two or more columns concatenated as the 'value'.

      This can be used to enforce referential integrity by loading existing records to a dropdown menu for selection purpose only.

      Parameters:
      tableName - represents the table name
      connect - represents the database connection
      value - indicates whether the key should be appended to the value or not for display
      Returns:
      a LinkedHashMap object containing all records.

    • loadDynaRecord

      public static LinkedHashMap loadDynaRecord(String conditionColumn, String conditionValue, String tableName, Connection connect, Boolean value)

      This method is used to load the specified columns listed using the setColumnNames(String...columns) method with the first column representing the 'key', and the rest, in the case two or more columns concatenated as the 'value', based on a given criteria

      This can be used to enforce referential integrity by loading existing records to a dropdown menu for selection purpose only.

      Parameters:
      conditionColumn - represents the condition column
      conditionValue - represents the condition column value
      tableName - represents the table name
      connect - represents the database connection
      value - indicates whether the key should be appended to the value or not for display
      Returns:
      a LinkedHashMap object containing all records based on a satisfied condition.

    • loadCustomRecords

      public static LinkedHashMap loadCustomRecords(String query, Boolean value, Connection conn)

      This method is used to load records based on a user-defined query with the first column representing the 'key', and the rest, in the case two or more columns concatenated as the 'value', based on a given criteria

      This can be used to enforce referential integrity by loading existing records to a dropdown menu for selection purpose only.

      Parameters:
      query - represents the user defined query
      value - indicates whether the key should be appended to the value or not for display
      conn - represents the database connection
      Returns:
      a LinkedHashMap object containing all records based on the executed query.

    • getFieldValue

      public static String getFieldValue(String column, String id, String id_val, String tablename, Connection conn)
      This method is used to get a single field value based on a criteria and returns it as a String.
      Parameters:
      column - represents the column record to be populated
      id - represents the condition criteria column.
      id_val - represents the condition column value
      tablename - represents the table name
      conn - represent the connection object
      Returns:
      a single field value as String

    • getCustomFieldValue

      public static String getCustomFieldValue(String query, Connection connect)
      This method is used to get a single field value and returns it as a String. it takes a custom user-defined query for execution.
      Parameters:
      query - represents query to return a single column/field value.
      connect - represent the connection object
      Returns:
      a single field value as String

    • loadFieldValues

      public static WebRowSet loadFieldValues(String column, String id, String id_val, String tablename, Connection conn)
      This is use to return single column records like all emails, etc
      Parameters:
      column - represents the column record to be populated
      id - represents the condition criteria column.
      id_val - represents the condition column value
      tablename - represents the table name
      conn - represent the connection object
      Returns:
      a WebrowSet object of all single column records.

    • getLastID

      public static String getLastID(String tableName, String column, Connection conn)
      This method is used to return the last ID value of the specified column.
      Parameters:
      tableName - represents the table name.
      column - represents the column name.
      conn - represent the connection object
      Returns:
      String value of the last column value

    • getCustomLastID

      public static String getCustomLastID(String querys, Connection conn)
      This method is used to return the last ID column value. Where '*" is used in the query in place of the column, it will return the first field value name
      Parameters:
      querys - represents the custom query to return the last id value.
      conn - represent the connection object
      Returns:
      String value of the field
